metadata.title: CVE-2022-1205 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s AmateurRadio AX.25 protocol functionality in the way a user connects with theprotocol. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1078-gke - 5.4.0-1078.84
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.14.0-1036-oem - 5.14.0-1036.40
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1011-gke - 5.15.0-1011.14~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
linux-hwe-5.11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.13').
linux-hwe-5.13: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.15, was needed').
